title: Football agent claims he offered Alexandre Lacazette to Russian side
text:

A Russian football agent has claimed he offered Alexandre Lacazette to Zenit St-Petersburg over the summer and suggested that the Arsenal striker has a £61million release clause.

Lacazette is currently in his third season with the Gunners after joining the club from French side Lyon in 2017.

After an impressive 2018/19 campaign which saw him score 19 goals in all competitions, Dmitry Cheltsov says he offered the Frenchman to Russian champions Zenit, only for them to sign Malcom from Barcelona instead.

Cheltsov also claimed that the 28-year-old had a £61m (€68m) release clause in his contract and that Zenit might be able to get him for around £45m, the same fee the Gunners paid two years ago.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

He told Sports Business Gazeta (via football.london ): "I offered Alexandre Lacazette to Zenit. Their sporting director Javier Ribalta said to me: ‘Are you crazy? His release clause is €68m.’

"I told him you can negotiate with Arsenal. I am sure they will be ready to accept something between €50m and €55m. His salary would be €7-8m after tax."

Despite Cheltsov's claims, football.london has claimed that Arsenal had no intention of parting company with Lacazette, who has found the net twice in three games already this season.

(Image: Getty Images)

The publication also denies the suggestions that the French striker has a release clause in his current contract, which runs until 2022.

Lacazette has not played since scoring in the 2-2 draw with Tottenham at the start of September as he continues to recover from an ankle injury.

However, he could be in line to make his return against Sheffield United after the international break after returning to training at London Colney last week.
description: Russian agent Dmitry Cheltsov also suggested that the French striker has a £61million release clause
